articles.title: Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Various Fields of Samjiyon County
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Various Fields of Samjiyon County
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to various fields of Samjiyon County.
					 He together with officials accompanying him paid tribute to leader Kim Jong Il before his statue in the county
					
					 He visited the Samjiyon County Hall of Culture.
					
					 He learnt in detail about the management and operation of the hall, asking if the county's art group is working regularly, how films are shown and how photo exhibition is organized.
					
					 Underscoring the need for the hall to organize brisk socio-political activities and mass cultural and art activities to make a positive contribution to firmly equipping the people and school youth and children with the Juche idea and Songun revolutionary idea of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and preparing them as persons possessed of versatile knowledge and cultural attainments, he was so kind as to promise the Party would send equipment necessary for managing and operating the hall.
					
					 Then he visited the Samjiyon Schoolchildren's Palace.
					
					 Watching the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il displayed on the frontal wall  of the palace, he was pleased that their portraits were displayed with due respect so that the members of the hobby groups of the palace might always watch them who loved children so much all their lives.
					
					 He looked round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room dedicated to the history of the palace.
					
					 Saying that the historic materials showing the noble love of the great leaders for the younger generation and future are the treasures to be handed down to posterity, he called for effectively conducting education through their immortal leadership exploits and training more talented children so as to eternally add shine to the noble intention of the great leaders. He went round various places of the palace including the room for math group, the room for automobile group, gymnasium, the room for narration group, the room for mass political activities, the room for IT group, the room for fine art group, the room for national musical instrument group and theatre.
					
					 Watching with smile on his face schoolchildren's various hobby group activities, he praised them for being good at tractor practice and editing multi-media, successfully playing various musical instruments, singing and drawing well and playing with balls well, he told them to work hard so as to become competent builders of socialist Korea.
					
					 It is the Party's duty and mission to realize the noble intention of the great leaders who said that there is nothing to spare for children, he told the officials to spruce up the palace in such a manner as to be the one to be proud of before the world. He showed for the palace such profound care to go down in history and gave important instructions which would serve as guidelines for managing and operating the palace.
					
					 When members of each hobby group vied with each other to run into his arms, shouting with emotion "Fatherly Marshal! We have longed to see you," he kindly responded to them by saying "I have come to you as I wished to see you so much." Then he took them in his arms and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 Saying that there may be some schoolchildren and teaching staff who might feel regretful for missing the happy event of photographing, he spared precious time to wait till all officials, teachers and members of the hobby groups have gathered. Then he had a photo session with all of them.
					
					 He also visited the Camp for Visitors to the Samjiyon Revolutionary Battle Sites.
					
					 He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room dedicated to the history of the camp.
					
					 He said that historic relics and mementoes on display alone clearly tell what deep attention the great leaders paid to helping officials, party members and other working people deeply grasp the revolutionary traditions of the WPK.
					
					 He looked round various places such as the camping houses for university students and members of the Children Union to learn in detail about the reconstruction and operation of the camp.
					
					 Calling upon the officials and employees of the camp to creditably fulfill their mission and thus make a positive contribution to helping the visitors know well about the history of the resistance struggle waged by Kim Il Sung despite all sorts of hardships and deeply grasp the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu, eternal foundation of the WPK, he promised to make sure that the Party would directly provide means necessary for educating visitors.
					
					 He watched the skiers of the Sajabong Sports Team in training.
					
					 It is good to make the school youth and children ski a lot in the snowy areas such as Ryanggang Province, he said, adding that skiing is a very good exercise for physical training and redoubling courage and bravery.
					
					 He set forth important tasks for turning Samjiyon County into a grand open-air museum for educating people in the revolutionary traditions, exemplary unit in potato farming and an icon which fully realized the comprehensive mechanization of agriculture and indicated specific ways for carrying out them.
					
					 Accompanying him was Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., the WPK, and Kim Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Myong Guk
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Myong Guk
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Monday sent a wreath to the bier of Army General of the Korean People's Army Kim Myong Guk, winner of Order of Kim Il Sung and Order of Kim Jong Il, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, sent a wreath to the Cuban embassy here on Monday, expressing deep condolences over the death of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 The wreath was laid before a photo of Fidel Castro Ruz at the embassy.

articles.title: Senior Officials of Party, State and Army Express Condolences over Death of Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Senior Officials of Party, State and Army Express Condolences over Death of Fidel Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Senior officials of the Party, state and army visited the Cuban embassy here on Monday to express condolences over the death of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Pak Yong Sik, Ri Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae, Ri Man Gon, O Su Yong, Kwak Pom Gi, Kim Yong Chol and Ri Yong Ho, Ri Il Hwan and An Jong Su, department directors of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Kim Yong Jae, minister of External Economic Relations, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, and officials concerned.
					
					 Laid before his photo were wreaths sent by the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the Cabinet of the DPRK, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the International Department of the C.C., the WPK, the Foreign Ministry, the Ministry of External Economic Relations, the Education Commission, the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to him, a prominent politician, and made entries in the mourner's book.

articles.title: Message of Condolences to Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Message of Condolences to Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of condolence to Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, on Sunday.
					 The message said that though Fidel Castro Ruz passed away, the feats he performed for the Cuban revolution and the fraternal relations of friendship between the two countries would remain forever.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Cuban party, government and people would convert their sorrow into strength and courage and steadily register good successes in the struggle to defend socialism and revolution.

articles.title: DPRK Party and State Delegation Leaves for Cuba
articles.content:
DPRK Party and State Delegation Leaves for Cuba
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A DPRK party and state delegation led by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the WPK Central Committee, left here for Havana Monday to express condolences over the death of Fidel Castro Ruz, supreme leader of the Cuban revolution.
					 The delegation includes Kim Yong Su, department director of the C.C., WPK, So Hong Chan, first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Ryu Myong Son, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, and Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: DPRK Sets Period of Mourning for Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
DPRK Sets Period of Mourning for Fidel Castro Ruz 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK decided to set a three-day mourning period from Nov. 28 to 30 and raise flags at half-mast at buildings of important institutions and fixed places to mourn over the death of Fidel Castro Ruz. 
					 The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet issued a joint decision in this regard on Nov. 27.

articles.title: Brief History of Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Brief History of Fidel Castro Ruz 
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro Ruz was born in Oriente Province of Cuba on August 13, 1926.
					 He graduated from a middle school at Santiago de Cuba City and was admitted to Havana University in 1945. And he was called to the bar after graduation of the university.
					
					 He took part in the struggle against violence and corruption of the dictatorial regime at home and abroad from 1947 to 1952.
					
					 He, together with 165 young men and women students who were armed with the idea against dictatorship, attacked Moncada Barrack, a point of military importance for the Batista dictatorial regime in Santiago de Cuba City, kindling the flames of armed struggle.
					
					 He was arrested with more than 100 members who took part in the armed struggle as they failed in the first armed uprising and served prison term on Pinos Island of Cuba (Juventud Island at present).
					
					 After his release in May 1955, he organized the "July 26 movement". He went to Mexico as an exile together with his comrades in July 1955 and prepared for guerrilla struggle.
					
					 He landed in Oriente Province of Cuba by "Granma" ship with 82 armed fellows from Mexico in December 1956 and staged an armed struggle with Mt. Sierra Maestra as a base.
					
					 He finally overturned the dictatorial regime of Batista in January 1959 and achieved the victory of the Cuban revolution.
					
					 He was appointed as president of the Council of Ministers in Feb. 1959 and had worked as the first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba from Oct. 1965.
					
					 He was elected and worked as first secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Cuba from the First Congress to the Fifth Congress of the Party.
					
					 He was elected to be president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba several times at the National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba.
					
					 He resigned from his post as president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers at the First Session of the 7th National Assembly of People's Power in Feb. 2008 and from his post as first secretary of the CPC Central Committee at the Sixth Party Congress in April 2011 for the health condition and began writing books.
					
					 Fidel Castro Ruz visited the DPRK in March 1986. He met with President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and made great efforts to deepen the militant friendship and friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries fighting in the outpost of anti-U.S., anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 He was awarded several orders of the DPRK including the title of DPRK Hero. 
					
					 He passed away to our sorrow at 10:29 on Nov. 25, 2016.
					
					 His feats for the victorious advance in the cause of anti-imperialist independence and socialism and the development of the DPRK-Cuba friendly relations will remain forever.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Palestine
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Palestine
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine, on the Day of World Solidarity with the Palestinian people.
					 The message said that the Korean people extend invariable support and solidarity to the Palestinian people in their just cause of terminating the occupation by Israel and retaking the legitimate national rights including the right to found an independent state with east Kuds as its capital city.
					
					 It wished the president and people of Palestine new success in their struggle to put an end to Israel's illegal expansion of the Jewish settlements in the territory of Palestine and racist crackdown and achieve fair and lasting peace in the Middle East.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Mauritania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Mauritania
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz, president of Mauritania, on the 56th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the president and people of Mauritania greater success in the struggle to preserve peace and stability of the country and achieve its development and prosperity and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two counties with long history and tradition would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Albania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Albania
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Bujar Nishani, president of Albania, on its national day.
					 The message wished the Albanian president success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK side headed by Kim Yong Chol, first vice-minister of Electric Power Industry,  left here on Monday to take part in the 68th meeting of the Board of Directors of the Korea-China Hydro-Electric Power Company to be held in Beijing.

articles.title: Armenian President Supports DPRK Policy
articles.content:
Armenian President Supports DPRK Policy
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jun, DPRK ambassador to Armenia, presented his credentials to Armenian President Serge Sarkissian on November 22.
					 On the occasion the president said he had good feelings toward the DPRK making prominent achievements in various fields, stressing the need to develop in a reciprocal way the relations between the two countries.
					
					 Supporting the DPRK's policy for bolstering the defense capability and achieving the peaceful reunification of Korea, he sincerely hoped that everything would go well in the DPRK under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Tideland Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Tideland Held
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of tideland was held at the Sci-Tech Complex on Nov. 27 and 28.
					 The presentation was sponsored by the C.C., the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea. Present there were officials, teachers, researchers, designers and graduate students of more than 10 units including Kim Il Sung University and the Branch Academy of Hydraulic and Marine Sciences under the State Academy of Sciences, the tideland designing institute and the General Enterprise for Tideland Reclamation of North Phyongan Province.
					
					 It heard over 70 papers on achievements made in the researches to put the tideland reclamation on a modern and scientific basis.
					
					 The participants exchanged successes and experience gained in the reclamation of tideland through the introduction of science and technology.

articles.title: Symposium of Historians Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Symposium of Historians Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- There took place a symposium of historians from across the country at Kim Il Sung University on Monday to mark the 40th anniversary of the instruction given by President Kim Il Sung to reexamine the history of human evolution and development in Korea.
					 Present there were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, Ri Hye Jong, president of the Academy of Social Sciences, and Ryong Ju, director of the National Authority for the Protection of Cultural Heritage.
					
					 Speakers there said the great persons of Mt. Paektu advanced the unique idea and theory on the time-honored history of Korea and the origin of the Koreans and wisely led the work to settle the issue of history of human evolution and development on the Juche-based viewpoint and thus performed exploits to be conveyed down through generations. 
					
					  The President and leader Kim Jong Il also clarified the principled issues arising in eliminating flunkeyism and dogmatism and establishing Juche in the study of the human origin and development and the orientation and ways to dynamically conduct the work of excavating historic relics, they noted, adding:
					
					 Under the leadership and care of the great persons of Mt. Paektu, fossils proving the existence of the Paleolithic Age and history of human origin and development were excavated in a consecutive order to lay a foundation for formulating and systemizing the history of human evolution and development on a more scientific basis.
					
					 The Korean nation is a group of people formed on the territory of Korea at the dawn of human history and a homogenous nation that carried forward a single lineage and achieved the common bonds of kinship in the whole historical period of its formation and development. 
					
					 They renewed their pledge to preserve and add glory to the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for anthropology and fulfill their responsibility and duty in educating all the service personnel and people in the Korean-nation-first spirit.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Tours Sci-Tech Complex
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Tours Sci-Tech Complex
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Japanese delegation for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism headed by Sakae Araki visited the Sci-Tech Complex on Monday.
					 They bowed to the art work depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the complex.
					
					 Being briefed on the complex, they went round various places including the applied sci-tech hall, children's dream hall and e-library.
					
					 They also toured Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School and the Youth Movement Museum that day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from the visiting Japanese delegation for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					 Sakae Araki, the head of the delegation, handed over the floral basket to an official concerned on Monday.

articles.title: Delegation of Chongryon Officials Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Chongryon Officials Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) led by Kang Yong Chol, department director of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Members of the delegation toured the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum where the historical data and relics related with the revolutionary history of the President and life of his family members are on display.
					
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary life and feats of the President, they went round historic relics preserved with much care at his old home.
					
					 They also toured the Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, etc.

articles.title: Pyongyang Jonghyang Building Materials Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Jonghyang Building Materials Factory
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The construction of the dwelling houses and public buildings was completed in the flood-hit areas of North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK. In their construction, building materials made by advanced technologies were used.
					 One of them is anti-freezing concrete hardening accelerator which helps carry out concrete tamping in low temperature without corrosion of reinforcement bars.
					
					 It was developed by the Pyongyang Jonghyang Building Materials Factory, one of building materials producers in the DPRK. 
					
					 The factory produces scores of kinds of building materials, including concrete additives, waterproof agents and inorganic heat-insulating materials, for green architecture and dry-process fabrication.
					
					 Its products have been applied to the construction of monumental edifices like the Sci-Tech Complex and Ryugyong General Ophthalmic Hospital.
					
					 The factory is located in Rangnang District.

articles.title: Scientific Achievements Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Scientific Achievements Made in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Institutes under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK have made sci-tech achievements one after another.
					 The Control Machine Institute developed CNC devices for machine tools and the Microbiological Research Institute realized the home production of yogurt spore. And the Paper Engineering Institute succeeded in making highly efficient air filtration paper.
					
					 The Architectural Engineering Branch set a skyscraper designing standard, while the Central Mining Research established a process for producing ceramic glaze.
					
					 The Ferrous Mining Research Institute built a magnetizing roasting process to raise the standard of siderite and the Natural Energy Institute made a large-capacity submersible pump. And the Geological Institute stroke a big coal deposit in South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Praiseworthy successes have also been witnessed at the Hamhung Branch, Silicate Engineering Institute, Nano Materials Institute, Bioengineering Branch and Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Warns Japan of Its Revival of Militarism
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Warns Japan of Its Revival of Militarism
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Japan decided to give a task for going into urgent action under the "security legislation" to the unit of the Ground "Self-Defense Force" to be dispatched to South Sudan at the ministerial meeting on Nov. 15. According to the "urgent action," it will start its operation from December 12.
					 This is a part of the reckless moves of the Japanese reactionaries to revive militarism escalating under the signboard of "peace-keeping activities."
					
					 Now the Japanese authorities claim that the new task is to "ensure peace and security in the region and it is a new step in the history of Self-Defense Forces (SDF) for international peace-keeping cooperation."
					
					 This is a serious mockery of the international community.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, Japan has no qualifications to talk about world peace and security. 
					
					 Japan is the war criminal state which imposed immeasurable misfortune and pain upon mankind in the first half of the last century and caused disastrous consequences to ensuring world peace and security.
					
					 Japan is the only country which has not yet sincerely admitted its crimes but evaded its obligation to make reparation to the victims.
					
					 Furthermore, Japan is going reckless obsessed with the daydream for becoming "the leader of East" by enforcing a law on war.
					
					 Japan expanded the sphere of action of the SDF which had been limited to surrounding areas of Japan to worldwide and made it possible to conduct military actions anywhere under the pretext of military support for the U.S. and other allies by amending the "Japan-U.S. Defence Cooperation Guidelines" and adopting the "security legislation".
					
					 The "law on the readjustment of peace and security legislation," one of the main contents of the "security legislation", is paving the way for SDF to join in a war ignited by the U.S. forces and other allied forces anywhere in the world.
					
					 That is why the "security legislation" is inviting strong opposition at home and abroad.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries advertise that the "security legislation" is a peace law, but the Japanese people branded it as a law of war and oppose any action pursuant to it.
					
					 According to a recent opinion poll conducted by Kyodo News, most of the respondents said "no" to the task for "urgent action" in South Sudan.
					
					 Meanwhile, the participants in the rally held in Misawa City, Aomori Prefecture, strongly protested against the dispatch of forces to dangerous strife-torn areas abroad, saying that it is to make the government acquire  concessions through war.
					
					 This reflects the instable mindset of the Japanese people that Japan would be embroiled in a war again through the revision of the constitution and overseas dispatch of the SDF being pushed forward by the Abe ruling quarters.
					
					 The international community neither asks nor wants Japan, which is reviving as an extremely dangerous aggression force and war force, to make contributions to world peace. 
					
					 The new task for urgent action given to the Ground "Self-Defense Force" is a "new step" for war, not "international peace", revealing the militarist picture of Japan in the reckless moves once again.
					
					 The world people should heighten vigilance against Japan's bid to revive militarism, clearly understanding its danger.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Group of Traitors for Trying to Stifle DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Group of Traitors for Trying to Stifle DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea, during his foreign tour, cried out for tighening the diplomatic and military pressure on the DPRK like "two blades of scissors" under the pretext of "unprecedented nuclear and missile threats from the north".
					 Even the Chongwadae devil grandma more dead than alive convened what they called a "security council," at which she called for doing the utmost to "continue to ratchet up the powerful sanctions and pressure on the north."
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet regime is busy sending a delegation to the U.S. in order to put in tune the "cooperation with its new administration in ratcheting up pressure on the north."
					
					 People all over the world are ridiculing the living corpse-like puppet regime for its call for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK, Rodong Sinmun says in an article Monday, adding:
					
					 The south Korean regime has got paralyzed in elementary thinking with its dependence on foreign forces and confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 History and reality clearly show that no economic sanctions and blockade by the hostile forces can ever work on the DPRK.
					
					 Although the group of traitors has become very talkative about the "collapse" of the DPRK, it is they who are to meet the fate of collapse.
					
					 Miserable death and ruin are the unavoidable fate of Park and her group.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hits Park Geun Hye for Her Bid to Stay in Power
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hits Park Geun Hye for Her Bid to Stay in Power
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Nowadays Park Geun Hye of south Korea is going shameless enough to resume her "administration," challenging the public demands for her resignation.
					 This can be illustrated by the facts that she was busy appointing secretaries of Chongwadae and ambassadors, conferring "writs of appointment" on "provincial governors" of the "the committee of the five provinces of the north" and presiding over various meetings.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The traitor is making her last-ditch efforts to stay in power, saying that she would do her best to prevent any miscarriage in the administration.
					
					 This disgusting action is stunning the world people because she deserves a stern judgment by history as the chief culprit of the extra-large scandal.
					
					 Park still makes foolish attempt to stay in power as she has no elementary ability to face up to the trend of the times, to say nothing of politics, but is only blinded with greed for power.
					
					 Lurking behind her desperate bid is a cynical ploy to prolong her remaining days by rallying conservative forces through procrastination.
					
					 It is her ulterior motive to weather the worst ruling crisis and complete her term of office by making the present situation drag on indefinitely through cunning delaying tactics.
					
					 Tragedy is that she does not know that her gimmick can never work.
					
					 There is no way out for her.

articles.title: U.S. Should Make Decision to Withdraw Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Should Make Decision to Withdraw Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Clapper, director of the National Intelligence Agency of the U.S., said that the DPRK would never abandon nuclear weapons as it regards them as a means for protecting itself from the hostile forces and, accordingly, an attempt for the denuclearization of the DPRK denuclearization came to failure.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary describes his remarks as an objective estimation of the present situation in the DPRK.
					
					 No matter how loudly the Obama group may assert the theory of "denuclearization of Korea", it will prove ineffective, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 The theory of "denuclearization of Korea" was buried in the grave of history. The Obama group makes desperate efforts to evade from the shame of failure, but in vain.
					
					 The Obama group is preaching the new administration to follow its policy, far from drawing a lesson from the fact that it turned the DPRK into a nuclear power through the persistent enforcement of the "strategic patience". The group hopes that the new administration would wipe away the bitter disgrace it suffered in the DPRK-U.S. confrontation.
					
					 However, the history of the DPRK-U.S. confrontation showed that no matter how desperately the U.S. may resort to the military pressure and sanctions, Songun Korea would become stronger and the danger of security on the U.S. mainland would grow as much. 
					
					 Gone are the days never to return when the U.S. used to admonish full-fledged sovereign states while professing knowing everything as if it were an international judge.
					
					 The U.S. should discard its anachronistic daydream, though belatedly, and make a decision to withdraw its hostile policy toward the DPRK, clearly understanding the latter's strategic position.

articles.title: "Saenuri Party" and Plutocrats, Conspirators of Park Geun Hye, under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Saenuri Party" and Plutocrats, Conspirators of Park Geun Hye, under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The representative of the Minju Party of south Korea on Nov. 25 said at a ceremony of inaugurating the Pusan branch of the Headquarters of the People's Sovereign Movement for Resignation of Park Geun Hye that the "Saenuri Party" is a accomplice and a group for compulsory service as it deceived citizens of Pusan and protected Park, according to the south Korean Newsis.
					 She said that the "Saenuri Party" closed its eyes to the chief culprit of LCT scandal by depending on the nexus between politics and business.
					
					 She stressed that the sovereign people should punish Park Geun Hye and the "Saenuri Party".

articles.title: S. Korean Politicians and Elder Religionists Release Agreement Demanding Park Geun Hye's Resignation
articles.content:
S. Korean Politicians and Religionists Demand Park Geun Hye's Resignation
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The former "National Assembly" speaker, "prime minister" and other politicians and elder religionists of south Korea held a meeting on Sunday to issue an agreement declaring Park Geun Hye's resignation, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 They stressed the need for Park to entrust the "administration of state affairs" to the new "prime minister" for earlier "presidential election". 
					
					 The ruling and opposition political forces should exercise influence on forcing Park to step down, they added.

articles.title: Fifth All-People Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fifth All-People Action Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The fifth all-people action to oust traitor Park Geun Hye from office was reportedly staged all at once in different parts of south Korea including Seoul on Nov. 26.
					 More than 1.9 million people including workers, peasants and children took part in the action.
					
					 In the wake of holding group-and strata-specific advance meetings and march to encircle Chongwadae in major places of Seoul, the citizen's council for realizing democracy in south Korean society met again at Seoul Square.
					
					 They gathered in the Plaza of Kwanghwamun to have a full-dress meeting for the fifth all-people action. 
					
					 The meeting with the attendance of 600,000 people was started and, in a split second, its scale increased to at least 1.5 million.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, its participants started the second march to encircle Chongwadae from eight routes. They held a speech-making meeting denouncing the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for their crimes till the morning of Nov. 27.
					
					 Timed to coincide with the massive struggle in Seoul, candlelight vigils and demonstrations took place simultaneously with the attendance of 400,000 people in more than 100 different local areas.
					
					 Media reported that large-scale meetings were held in different parts of south Korea with more than 1.9 million people in attendance.

articles.title: Korean Young People in Japan Launch Protest Action outside South Korean Embassy
articles.content:
Young Koreans in Japan Launch Protest Action outside S. Korean Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A protest action group of Korean youths involving officials of the Korean Youth League in Japan and the Union of Korean Students in Japan in Tokyo and Kanto launched a struggle for resignation of Park Geun Hye outside the south Korean embassy in Tokyo on Nov. 24.
					 The group was stopped by the Japanese police in street hundreds of meters away from the south Korean embassy, but its members went through the police line with fierce fighting.
					
					 The group read out a letter of protest and conveyed it to the south Korean embassy. 
					
					 The protest letter said that Park took office by illegal election and destroyed the north-south relations while escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen and drove the situation of the Korean peninsula to the brink of war with the backing of the U.S.
					
					 She turned south Korea into a veritable hell by committing all sorts of evils and sold off dignity and interests of the nation by concluding a humiliating "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and an agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan, it pointed out.
					
					 The members of the group expressed the strong will of Korean youths in Japan to join in the efforts of youths in south Korea and all other Koreans and force Park Geun Hye to step down immediately.

articles.title: Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The 34th national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification took place in Nagano of Japan on November 19.
					 Attending the meeting were Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and Tomohiko Murayama, chairman of the Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, members of the executive committee of the meeting and representatives of solidarity organizations in different parts of Japan.
					
					 Present on invitation were officials of Chongryon including Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 After congratulatory speeches, a message of greetings from the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries was read out at the meeting.
					
					 Kenji Mizutani, general secretary of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, made a keynote report.
					
					 He exposed the injustice and illegality of the anti-DPRK campaign conducted by the US, Japan and south Korea and of the UN Security Council's "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 He stressed the need to strengthen solidarity with the Korean people and conduct vigorous activities supporting the friendship between the two countries and the reunification of Korea.
					
					 Several figures made speeches on the theme of "For the peaceful reunification of the Korean peninsula-exposure of the true nature of U.S.-Japan-south Korea military alliance" at the meeting.
					
					 The meeting adopted an appeal sharply denouncing the anti-DPRK moves of the U.S., Japan and south Korea and demanding the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, the conclusion of DPRK-U.S. peace accord and the normalization of Japan-DPRK diplomatic relations.
					
					 In the meantime, an event was held on Nov. 18-19 to mark the 40th anniversary of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Bratislava of Slovakia on Nov. 21.
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea and chairman of the Slovak-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to send a message to supreme leader Kim Jong Un and hold significant political and cultural events praising the revolutionary life and feats of Kim Jong Il on the fifth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Appeal of Int'l Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons Supported
articles.content:
Appeal of Int'l Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons Supported
 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Nepalese National Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu issued a statement on Nov. 16 in support of an appeal made by the International Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu.
					 The statement said that the year 2017 is of significance as it marks the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il and the 5th anniversary of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's assumption of the top party and state posts in the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The International Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu and national preparatory committees should organize various political and cultural events on a worldwide scale to give wide publicity to the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un and thus make great contributions to accomplishing the human cause of independence.
					
					 Wishing success to the International Preparatory Committee, the statement extended full support to the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the peaceful reunification of Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile, Norma G. Binas, vice-president of the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula, issued a statement on Nov. 20 in congratulation of the formation of the International Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 In the statement he declared that together with the Philippine Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Philippines Solidarity Committee would positively conduct political and cultural events across the Philippines since January of 2017 to praise the greatness and exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 He said that he would take part in the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu to be held in Mt. Paektu and Pyongyang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno labores del distrito de Samjiyon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno labores del distrito de Samjiyon
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno las labores de varios dominios del distrito de Samjiyon.
					El Comandante Supremo rindio homenaje al Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante su estatua de bronce erigida en el distrito, junto con los funcionarios acompanados.
					
					Kim Jong Un visito la Casa Cultural del distrito de Samjiyon.
					
					Sentado en un asiento, se cercioro en detalles del estado de la administracion y operacion de la casa cultural, preguntando si se desarrollan normalmente las actividades del grupo artistico del distrito, como se organizan la proyeccion filmica y la exposicion fotografica y otros.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de dinamizar mas las actividades socio-politicas y artistico-culturales de masas para armar al pueblo, jovenes y ninos escolares con la idea Juche, la revolucionaria de Songun de nuestro partido, y formarles como hombres con conocimientos multilaterales y nobles cualidades y prometio enviar a la casa cultural los equipos necesarios a su operacion.
					
					Kim Jong Un estuvo en el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Samjiyon.
					
					Mirando las imagenes sonrientes del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il colocadas en la pared frontal del edificio, dijo que las fueron acondicionadas bien para que los miembros del palacio puedan ver cada dia las imagenes generosas de los grandes Lideres quienes siempre amaban tanto a los ninos.
					
					Recorrio la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la otra de presentacion del historial.
					
					Senalo que los datos alusivos al noble amor del Presidente y el Dirigente a los miembros de las generaciones venideras son valiosos patrimonios a ser transmitidos para siempre y acentuo la necesidad de hacer bien la educacion en las proezas de direccion de los grandes Lideres y criar mucho mas a los ninos talentosos, para materializar sin parar los propositos de los grandes Lideres.
					
					Paso revista a varios puntos del palacio como las salas del grupo de matematica, el grupo de carro, el grupo de oratoria, las actividades politicas de masas, el grupo de IT, el grupo de bellas artes, el grupo de instrumentos musicales folcloricos, el gimnasio, el teatro, etc.
					
					Mirando sonriente las actividades de los miembros de diferentes grupos, evaluaron sus talentos y les encomendo que sean trabajadores capaces de encargarse del futuro de Corea socialista al aprender con afan escatimando el tiempo.
					
					Es nuestra mision y obligacion acatar a los nobles propositos del Presidente y el Dirigente quienes habian dicho que para los ninos, no hay nada que escatimar, puntualizo y propuso acondicionar mejor el palacio. Dispenso al palacio las benevolencias generosas a ser transmitidas de generacion en generacion y dio valiosas instrucciones que serviran de guias en la administracion y gestion del palacio.
					
					En todas las salas del grupo por las que paso, se tomo fotografias junto a los ninos abrazandolos en su regazo. Y preocupandose por la ausencia de los funcionarios, maestros, empleados y miembros de grupos del palacio en la filmacion, espero a ellos y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Acto seguido, Kim Jong Un visito el campamento para los visitantes al campo de batalla revolucionaria de Samjiyon.
					
					Recorrio la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la de presentacion del historial.
					
					Senalo que los vestigios expuestos hacen conocer la gran atencion del Presidente y el Dirigente prestada a las labores para armar a los funcionarios, afiliados del partido y trabajadores con la tradicion revolucionaria de nuestro partido.
					
					Hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de remodelacion y administracion recorriendo varios lugares como los pabellones para los universitarios y los integrantes de la Organizacion de Ninos.
					
					Los funcionarios y empleados del campamento deben cumplir con sus deberes asumidos para que los campistas guarden en lo profundo del corazon la historia de la enconada lucha armada antijaponesa y el espiritu revolucionario del Paektu, eterno cimiento de nuestro partido, subrayo y prometio que enviaria los medios necesarios a la educacion de los visitantes.
					
					Por ultimo, Kim Jong Un presencio el entrenamiento de los esquiadores del Conjunto Deportivo Sajabong.
					
					Acoto que en la provincia de Ryanggang y otras localidades donde cae mucha nieve, hay que fomentar el esqui entre los jovenes y ninos escolares y anadio que ese deporte es bueno para cultivar la audacia y la valentia.
					
					Y presento las tareas programaticas para remodelar el distrito de Samjiyon como un gran museo al aire libre para la educacion en la tradicion revolucionaria, como una unidad ejemplar de la agricultura de patata y una unidad prototipica donde se haya realizada la mecanizacion perfecta de la economia rural y aclaro uno tras otro los remedios para el fin.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, y Kim Yong Su, jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de Kim Myong Guk
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de Kim Myong Guk
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Presidente Kim Jong Un envio el dia 28 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Myong Guk, general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del Ejercito Popular de Corea condecorado con las Ordenes Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral a embajada cubana en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral a embajada cubana en Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Presidente Kim Jong Un envio el dia 28 una ofrenda floral a la embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea en senal de profundas condolencias por el fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana.
					  La ofrenda floral fue depositada ante el retrato de Fidel Castro.

articles.title: Cuadros directivos coreanos expresan condolencias en embajada cubana
articles.content:
Cuadros directivos coreanos expresan condolencias en embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los cuadros directivos del Partido, el Estado y el ejercito visitaron el dia 28 la embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea y expresaron condolencias por el fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana.
					Entre los visitantes se distinguian Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Pak Yong Sik, Ri Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae, Ri Man Gon, O Su Yong, Kwak Pom Gi, Kim Yong Chol, Ri Yong Ho, Ri Il Hwan, An Jong Su, los jefes de departamentos del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el ministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero Kim Yong Jae, el presidente del Comite de Educacion Kim Sung Du, la presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Kim Jong Suk, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero So Ho Won, quien es tambien vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, y otros funcionarios de las ramas interesadas. 
					
					Fueron colocadas al pie de un retrato de Fidel las ofrendas florales enviadas por el CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, el Consejo de Ministros, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Departamento Internacional del CC del PTC, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Ministerio de Relacione Economicas con el Extranjero, el Comite de Educacion, el Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y el Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del celebre politico cubano y firmaron el libro de condolencias.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam y Pak Pong Ju envian mensaje de condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam y Pak Pong Ju envian mensaje de condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, y el premier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC, Pak Pong Ju, enviaron la vispera un mensaje de condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz, primer secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba.
					  El mensaje apunta que aunque fallecio Fidel Castro Ruz, estaran siempre presentes sus hazanas registradas en la Revolucion Cubana y en las relaciones fraternales y de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					  Expreso la conviccion de que el partido, gobierno y pueblo cubanos sabran convertir la tristeza de hoy en la fuerza y coraje para seguir alcanzando exitos alentadores en la defensa del socialismo y la revolucion.

articles.title: Delegacion de la RPDC parte para expresar condolencias por deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Delegacion de la RPDC parte para expresar condolencias por deceso de Fidel Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido y el Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, partio el dia 28 de esta capital para expresar condolencias por el fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz, Supremo Lider de la Revolucion Cubana.
					  Los integrantes de la delegacion son el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Yong Su, el primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, So Hong Chan, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ryu Myong Son, el vicecanciller Sin Hong Chol y otros.

articles.title: Declarado duelo en Corea por el deceso de Fidel Castro
articles.content:
Declarado duelo en Corea por el deceso de Fidel Castro
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del fallecimiento de Fidel Castro Ruz, se ha declarado en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea el duelo de 3 dias desde el 28 al 30 de noviembre, en el cual se izaran las banderas a media asta en los edificios de instituciones importantes y los lugares senalados.
					  Quedo publicada la vispera la resolucion correspondiente a nombre comun del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC.

articles.title: Biografia de Fidel Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Biografia de Fidel Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Fidel Castro Ruz nacio el 13 de agosto de 1926 en la provincia cubana de Oriente. 
					Curso en una escuela secundaria de la ciudad de Santiago de Cuba e ingreso en la Universidad de La Habana en 1945.
					
					Al graduarse de la universidad, recibio el titulo de abogado. 
					
					Desde 1947 hasta 1952, tomo parte dentro y fuera del pais en la lucha contra las politicas violentas y corruptas del poder dictatorial. 
					
					En julio de 1953, ejecuto con 165 jovenes y estudiantes de ambos generos con el pensamiento antidictatorial el asalto al Cuartel Moncada, una de las importantes bases militares de la tirania batistiana situada en Santiago de Cuba, hecho que dio inicio a la lucha armada. 
					
					Fracasado en la primera rebelion armada, Fidel fue arrestado junto con mas de 100 rebeldes y guardo prision en la Isla de Pinos (actualmente Isla de la Juventud). 
					
					Luego de ponerse en libertad en mayo de 1955, organizo el "Movimiento del 26 de Julio". Y en julio del mismo ano, se exilio a Mexico con sus companeros de armas para preparar la lucha guerrillera. 
					
					En diciembre de 1956, desembarco con 82 rebeldes armados en la provincia de Oriente a bordo del yate "Granma" e inicio la lucha armada en la Sierra Maestra tomandola como base guerrillera. 
					
					En enero de 1959, derroto el poder dictatorial de Batista y logro el triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana. 
					
					En febrero de 1959, Fidel fue nombrado como primer ministro del Gobierno Revolucionario y desde octubre de 1965, trabajo de primer secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba. 
					
					Desde el primer Congreso del PCC hasta el quinto, ha sido ratificado como primer secretario del Comite Central del PCC. 
					
					Fue electo en varias ocasiones como presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros en la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular de la Republica de Cuba. 
					
					Por el problema de salud, dejo su cargo de presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros en febrero de 2008 en la primera sesion de la VII legislatura de la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular, y el puesto de primer secretario del Comite Central del Partido en el VI Congreso del PCC, celebrado en abril de 2011. Desde entonces, se dedico a escribir reflexiones. 
					
					En marzo de 1986, visito a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y sostuvo encuentros cordiales con el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Realizo grandes esfuerzos por fortalecer la amistad combativa y las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los pueblos de ambos paises que estan en la primera linea de la lucha antiyanqui y antiimperialista. 
					
					El intimo amigo y largo companero revolucionario de armas del pueblo coreano recibio el titulo de Heroe de la RPDC y otras condecoraciones de nuestro pais.
					
					Fidel Castro fallecio lamentablemente a las 10 y 29 del 25 de noviembre de 2016.
					
					Se quedaran para siempre sus hazanas realizadas por el avance victorioso de la causa de independencia antiimperialista y la socialista y por el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad Corea-Cuba.
